intro: Schoenoplectus jacobi, commonly known as the Jacob's bulrush, is a wetland plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. This plant typically grows in marshy or aquatic environments, forming dense stands that help stabilize soil and provide habitat for various wildlife. Its tall, cylindrical inflorescence consists of numerous small, three-ranked spikelets. Schoenoplectus jacobi is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and its ability to thrive in saturated soil conditions.
